member.name: M:System.Net.Battlefield3.RconClient.LogOn(System.String)
member.summary: Logs the onto the server without blocking the thread.
member.param: The password for the server's RCON interface.
member.remarks: If you'd like to block the thread while logging in, use

member.name: M:System.Net.Battlefield3.RconClient.LogOn(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Logs the onto the server.
member.param: The password for the server's RCON interface.
If true, the method will not block the thread, but you will not know if the login fails.
member.returns: True if login was successful or false on a failed login or when is True.
member.remarks: In order to ensure this method doesn't block the thread when is false, each point of communication (there are two of them), will wait a period of time before returning false, as defined by . In the final point of communication, it is possible that the login attempt will succeed after timeout, so, while this method would return false, the event would still be raised.

member.name: P:System.Net.Battlefield3.RconClient.DisableSynchronizeChecking
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not the events will not check to see if the target object implements .
member.remarks:
By default, will check to see if the target object, such as a , has set to true. If it does, the object's method will be called.
This property is used to disable this feature.

member.name: P:System.Net.Battlefield3.RconClient.SynchronousReadTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the timeout for synchronous reads, in seconds.
member.value: The timeout for synchronous reads, in seconds.
member.remarks:
Synchronous reads are reads that request and parse/return data in the same method.
By default, the timeout is 10 seconds.
One example of usage is the class. When getting the maplist, gets the data of three requests, and is able to return data.

member.summary: Occurs when a joins the server.

This event is raised the first time the shows up in .
Since this will be raised when a first ends up in , this event will be raised after the first connects. This behavior will be kept, for now, because it has some uses.
